examples: The chances that your Internet activity is being monitored are low, despite the ingressive nature of the modern Internet environment.

definitions.definition: Uttered by drawing air inward through the mouth or nose .
Aspectually indicating that an action is about to be entered or is in the process of being entered.
Being a source or channel through which water enters or once entered an area.
examples: This spring is the ingressive source of the water that flows through the cave.

secondary_definitions: ( phonetics , of a speech sound ) Uttered by drawing air inward through the mouth or nose .
( grammar ) Aspectually indicating that an action is about to be entered or is in the process of being entered.
( geology ) Being a source or channel through which water enters or once entered an area.
